#Text=Prior to her book 's publication , Scobee was threatened with legal action , in a letter from a lawyer Bertram Fields representing influential Scientology member and celebrity , actor Tom Cruise .
#Text=Separately , Scientology representative Tommy Davis stated the organization was also preparing a lawsuit against her related to the publication of her book .
#Text=Further news about such threatened lawsuits have not been forthcoming following these statements from Tom Cruise 's lawyer and Scientology 's spokesman .

#Text=After Scobee began to speak out critically about Scientology to the St. Petersburg Times , the Scientology propaganda publication Freedom Magazine issued a publication in which it referred to her repeatedly as " The Adulteress " .

#Text=Though Scobee had thought that statements she made during Scientology counseling sessions called " Auditing " were to be kept confidential under priest-penitent religious privilege , BBC News reported that " intimate details of her sex life " were forwarded by Scientology , to the St. Petersburg Times .

column1: #Text=BBC News reported that during an interview for the Panorama program , Scobee was photographed by agents for Scientology along with journalist John Sweeney .
#Text=These photographs were then sent by Scientology UK lawyers from the firm Carter-Ruck to the BBC , in an attempt to show " bias " of journalist Sweeney towards Scobee in his interviewing .
#Text=Scientology - Abuse at the Top received a favorable reception from reviews and media coverage .
#Text=All Headline News characterized it as a " tell-all book " about Scientology .
#Text=Scobee 's account has also received positive reception in coverage from Today Tonight , The Drew Marshall Show , Lateline , and Panorama .
#Text=Interview
#Text=How did you first get involved with Scientology ?
#Text=Amy Scobee
#Text=in 2007
#Text=Image : Amy Scobee .
#Text=I was 14 years old .
#Text=My parents had recently divorced and my mother took custody of me and my older brother .
#Text=The three of us moved 30 miles north to the Seattle area and my mother started working as a draftsman at a company near by .
#Text=My brother and I would go to school during the day and spend the evenings with our mom .
#Text=We ’d visit my father on the weekends .
#Text=I was beginning to get used to this routine when suddenly my mother was no longer spending the evenings with us .
#Text=Instead , she began attending classes after work at the local Church of Scientology .
#Text=One day I was home alone and the phone rang .
#Text=It was a staff member from the church named Brett .
#Text=I told him that my mom was n’t home .
#Text=He said that he was actually calling to talk to me .
#Text=He said that he heard I was a very nice person and that I should come into the church to do an introductory service myself .
#Text=I remember becoming very curious about this .
#Text=I recall thinking , " Even though I ’m just a kid , these guys are interested in me ! "
#Text=That somehow made me feel recognized and important .
